column2: One of the Golden Magus' most infamous creations, this fiery curved sword is kept most of the time inside a jar filled with a slimy orange solution. When drawn out of it, the sword catches a mystical fire that the Magus' uses for battle, theatrics and summoning Djinn spirits. Contrary to popular belief, the ship is named after the sword.
Magical Support: Piercing Bolts of Ruin
Orders the Flaming Scimitar's Fire Efreets to unleash a barrage of burning bolts upon your enemies.
Orders the Flaming Scimitar's Tempest Djinns to conjure a potent torrent of curved windswords upon the battlefield.
The dusty and unforgivable wind of the south, it brings with it the fury and the sweltering heat of the desert.
The cool and protective wind of the north, it blows away the evil and wrongness in the skies and shields all from harm.
A column of churning fire erupts from the battlefield, causing much destruction!
Searing flames burst from the caster, burning everything around them.
The power the Golden Magus wields comes at a price. If his concentration wanes during battle, the Djinn under his control will sense his weakness and attempt to turn the Magus' power against himself.
